heroIntro: Welcome to your family's next chapter. This 3-bedroom, 2-bathroom villa in San Juan de los Terreros offers the perfect blend of space, affordability, and Mediterranean living that growing families crave. At €356,500, you're investing in premium specification at 40% less than comparable properties in Spanish island markets—exceptional value that doesn't compromise on quality or location. The 110m² of thoughtfully designed living space sits on a generous 255m² plot, giving your family room to grow, play, and create memories. San Juan de los Terreros has become a preferred destination for British and international families seeking authentic Spanish coastal living without the overcrowding of major tourist areas. With established schools, safe neighbourhoods, and vibrant community life, this villa represents a genuine opportunity to enhance your family's lifestyle while building equity in one of Spain's most stable property markets.
areaSection: San Juan de los Terreros is a charming coastal town in Almería, eastern Costa Blanca, known for its authentic Spanish character and family-friendly atmosphere. Located between the popular resorts of Mojácar and Vera, it offers the best of both worlds—access to modern amenities while maintaining a genuine local feel. The Mediterranean climate brings over 300 days of sunshine annually, with mild winters and warm summers perfect for outdoor family activities. The town's pristine beaches feature Blue Flag status, indicating excellent water quality and safety standards. The wider Almería region has experienced steady infrastructure development, making it increasingly attractive to families seeking value without compromising on convenience. The laid-back pace of life here contrasts beautifully with the hustle of city living, yet major services remain readily accessible.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in San Juan de los Terreros revolves around family, community, and the sea. Your mornings might start with a beach walk before school runs, while afternoons offer time at local tapas bars where your children play safely alongside locals' families. The established expat community means English is widely spoken—you'll find support networks, international friendship groups, and schools that cater to British families. Weekly markets burst with fresh produce and seafood, supermarkets like Mercadona and Lidl stock familiar brands alongside Spanish specialties, and restaurants range from casual chiringuitos to fine dining. The neighbourhood is genuinely safe, with friendly neighbours and a strong community spirit. Weekend adventures are endless: hiking in nearby national parks, golf at championship courses, or exploring authentic white villages inland. Healthcare is excellent with English-speaking doctors readily available, and the pace of life naturally encourages family time—dinner together, beach visits, and shared activities form the rhythm of everyday living.
investmentSection: Beyond providing your family with an exceptional home, this property represents a sound financial investment. San Juan de los Terreros has seen consistent property appreciation of 8% year-on-year, outpacing inflation and demonstrating genuine demand. At €3,241/m², this villa commands a premium for its specifications but remains 40% below comparable properties in Ibiza, Mallorca, and Menorca—markets that have matured and face supply constraints. The rental market is equally compelling: similar 3-bedroom villas generate €800+ weekly rental income during peak seasons, offering potential offset to ownership costs if you decide to rent part of the year. The area attracts quality holiday-makers and long-term renters seeking authentic coastal Spain without Benidorm's density. Whether viewing this as a primary residence, investment property, or seasonal home, the fundamentals are solid: established market, growing expat community, stable rental demand, and capital appreciation potential.
conclusion: This 3-bedroom villa in San Juan de los Terreros represents more than a property purchase—it's an investment in your family's lifestyle, financial future, and quality of life. At €356,500, you're acquiring premium specification 40% below Spanish island markets while joining an established, welcoming community where your children will thrive and your money stretches further. The combination of affordable living, excellent healthcare, strong schools, safe neighbourhoods, and direct UK flight connections makes this a genuinely practical choice for families seeking Mediterranean living without compromise. Whether you're viewing this as a primary residence, investment property, or seasonal escape, the fundamentals are compelling: proven appreciation, rental income potential, and authentic Spanish living. healthcare.text: Healthcare in San Juan de los Terreros is excellent and reassuring for families. The nearest regional hospital in Almería is a 30-minute drive and offers comprehensive emergency services with English-speaking staff. Private clinics are also available throughout the area for non-urgent consultations. Many British expat families register with local doctors who speak English and understand international healthcare needs. Prescription medications are affordable and readily available at local pharmacies. Dental and optician services meet European standards. The healthcare system is straightforward for residents, and most families quickly integrate with local medical providers who offer personal, responsive care.

Most schools organise activities, sports, and cultural events that integrate children into the broader community while maintaining international standards.

faqs.question: Hvor mye koster denne eiendommen?

faqs.question: Kan utlendinger kjøpe eiendom i Spania?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Non-Spanish citizens and non-EU residents can purchase property in Spain without restrictions. You'll need a Spanish tax identification number (NIE), which we can guide you through obtaining. Most buyers work with bilingual property lawyers who handle all documentation and ensure compliance with Spanish law. The process is straightforward and transparent, and many British families have purchased successfully in San Juan de los Terreros.

faqs.question: Hva koster det å kjøpe eiendom i Spania?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price of €356,500, expect additional costs totalling approximately 8-10% of the property price. These include: transfer tax (6-8%, varies by region), legal fees (€800-1,200), notary fees (€400-600), property registration (€200-300), and surveyor costs if desired (€300-500). Annual ongoing costs include property tax (around €200-300 annually), community fees if applicable, and utilities. We provide transparent cost breakdowns before any commitment.

faqs.question: Er Costa Blanca et godt sted å kjøpe eiendom?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca offers excellent property investment fundamentals. The region has experienced consistent 8% year-on-year appreciation, established expat communities, strong rental demand, and lower entry prices than island markets. San Juan de los Terreros specifically attracts quality buyers seeking authentic Spanish living without overcrowding. Infrastructure improvements continue, and the area appeals to families, retirees, and investors—diverse demand supports long-term value stability.

faqs.question: Kan jeg få boliglån i Spania som utlending?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign buyers can obtain mortgages in Spain through Spanish banks and international lenders. Most banks require 20-30% down payment and thorough financial documentation. EU citizens typically find easier access than non-EU buyers. Several banks specialise in international mortgages with English-speaking advisors. At €356,500, monthly mortgage payments with 80% financing would be approximately €1,400-1,600 depending on interest rates and terms. We can connect you with mortgage brokers experienced in international financing.

faqs.question: Hva er levekostnadene på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Cost of living in San Juan de los Terreros is significantly lower than UK equivalents. Groceries, dining, utilities, and entertainment are 30-40% cheaper than equivalent expenses in Britain. A family of four can live comfortably on €1,800-2,200 monthly excluding mortgage. Restaurants offer three-course meals for €12-15, weekly shopping for a family costs €80-120, and utilities average €80-120 monthly. This affordability is a major draw for British families seeking to stretch their resources further.

faqs.question: Hvordan er været på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: San Juan de los Terreros enjoys 300+ days of annual sunshine with mild winters and warm summers. Average temperatures range from 12-17°C in winter to 25-28°C in summer. Rainfall is minimal, concentrated in autumn and spring. The Mediterranean climate is ideal for outdoor family living, beach visits year-round, and outdoor activities. Families particularly appreciate that winters remain mild enough for beach visits without excessive summer heat that can be challenging for young children.

faqs.question: Hvor langt er det fra Norge til Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Almería airport, 40 minutes from San Juan de los Terreros, offers direct flights to the UK with journey times of 2.5-3 hours. Multiple airlines operate these routes with competitive pricing, and flights are frequent. Many families maintain UK visits for holidays or family connections. The flight duration and accessibility means you're not choosing between Spain and UK connections—you can realistically manage both.

faqs.question: Is this villa suitable for a growing family?
faqs.answer: Yes, exceptionally so. The three spacious bedrooms accommodate growing children, parents, and guest visits comfortably. The 255m² plot provides outdoor space for play, gardens, or future development. Location in a safe, family-oriented neighbourhood with schools nearby, beaches within walking distance, and community events creates ideal conditions for raising children. The affordability compared to UK property means your budget stretches further, potentially enabling better schools, larger space, or additional savings.

faqs.question: What are the rental income possibilities for this property?
faqs.answer: Similar 3-bedroom villas in San Juan de los Terreros generate €800-1,000 weekly rental income during peak summer months (May-September) and €400-600 during shoulder seasons. At conservative estimates, annual rental revenue could reach €25,000-30,000 gross, depending on management and occupancy rates. Many owners rent 20-30 weeks annually, covering mortgages and costs while using the property privately remainder of the year. Professional management companies handle everything, simplifying ownership while generating income offset.
